avalancheActivity.comment: Due to rainfall, increasingly frequent moist/wet-snow avalanches are possible, esp. on steep slopes in all aspects below 2000m. Releases are relatively small and can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier. Such danger zones lie on very steep shady slopes and in transitions into gullies and bowls above 1900m on steep N/W/E facing slopes and in gullies and bowls and can reach medium size.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Rising danger of moist/wet avalanches due to rainfall. Attention: weak layers in old snow.

snowpackStructure.comment: More rainfall was registered than expected, but more is still expected, along with some snowfall esp. at high altitudes. Nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is nearly absent. The snowpack is moist.  In the lowermost part of the snowpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. above 2000.

tendency.highlights: Attention: wet snow and weak layers in the old snow

weatherForecast.comment: Isolated showers in early morning, later slackening off, then the clouds will disperse and sunny intervals are expected. In the afternoon, local showers again expected. Moderate SW winds. At 2000m: +1 degree. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.comment: Due to rainfall and the snowpack which is becoming thoroughly wet, increasingly frequent moist/wet-snow avalanches are possible, esp. on steep slopes in all aspects below 2000m. Releases are relatively small and can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier. Such danger zones lie on very steep shady slopes and in transitions into gullies and bowls above 2000m on steep N/W/E facing slopes and in gullies and bowls and can reach medium size. In addition, small snowdrifts accumulations require attentiveness, esp. at high altitudes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Moist/wet-snow avalanches still possible. Caution urged towards weak layers in old snow.

snowpackStructure.comment: Heavy snowfall (up to 20cm) over 2000m, some rainfall, more is expected esp. at high altitudes. Nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is nearly absent. The snowpack is moist.  In the lowermost part of the snowpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. at high altitudes. In the middle part of the snowpack on N/W/E facing slopes there are facted weak layers, esp. above 2000m. Due to fresh snowfall and moderate-to-strong velocity southerly winds, small snowdrift accumulations will be generated esp. in ridgeline terrain.

tendency.highlights: Beware wet snow and weak old snow

weatherForecast.comment: Isolated showers in early morning, later slackening off, then the clouds will disperse and sunny intervals are expected. In the afternoon, local showers again expected. Moderate SW winds. At 2000m: +1 degree. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.comment: Weak layers can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier. Such danger zones lie on N/W/E facing very steep shady slopes and in transitions into gullies and bowls above 2200m. Very isolated danger zones also occur on very steep sunny slopes above 2600m. Avalanches can in isolated cases reach medium size. In addition, fresh snowdrift accumulations require attentiveness, esp at high and high-alpine altitudes. Due to snowpack moistening, isolated moist loose-snow avalanches are possible, esp. on very steep slopes, small releases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution:  weak layers in the old snow, fresh snowdrifts at high and high-alpine altitudes

snowpackStructure.comment: 5-10cm fresh snow was registered, and some rainfall. More snowfall is anticipated, esp. at high altitudes.  In the middle part of the snowpack on N/W/E facing slopes there are faceted weak layers, esp above 2200m. Due to fresh snowfall and moderate-to-strong velocity southerly winds, small snowdrift accumulations were generated esp. in ridgeline terrain. Nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation hardly exists, which leads to increasing moistening of the snowpack esp. below 2200m.

tendency.highlights: Attention: weak old snow and fresh snowdrifts

weatherForecast.comment: On Sunday, dense clouds will accumulate due to strong-velocity SW winds, gusts reaching 80 km/hr.  In afternoon, precipitation will taper off in the southern regions. At 2000m: +1 degree. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.comment: Since the snowpack is becoming thoroughly wet, moist/wet avalanches can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier in all aspects on very steep shady slopes and in transitions into gullies and bowls, esp at high altitudes. Isolated danger zones occur esp. on very steep shady slopes at high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: Some rainfall below 2000m, and some snowfall, esp. at high altitudes. Nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is nearly absent. The snowpack is moist.  In the lowermost part of the snowpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. above 2000.

weatherForecast.comment: Isolated showers in early morning, later slackening off, then the clouds will disperse and sunny intervals are expected. In the afternoon, local showers again expected. Moderate SW winds. At 2000m: +1 degree. Source: GeoSphere

customData.generalHeadline: Moist/wet-snow avalanches still possible, esp. in southern regions
